runcharter 0.0.0.9000
  • Get started
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • How to create multiple runcharts

Create run chart with highlighted improvements where applicable.

Source: R/runcharter.R
runcharter.Rd

This will plot the original dataframe, with highlighted runs of improvement. It will also return a dataframe showing the improvement data.

runcharter(df, med_rows = 13, runlength = 9, line_colr = "#005EB8",
  point_colr = "#005EB8", median_colr = "#E87722",
  sus_fill = "#DB1884", chart_title = NULL, chart_subtitle = NULL,
  direction = "below", facet_cols = NULL, save_plot = FALSE,
  plot_extension = "png", ...)

Arguments

df

dataframe containing columns "date", "y", "grp"
med_rows

number of rows to base the initial median calculation over
runlength

how long a run of consecutive points should be before re-basing the median
line_colr

colour for runchart lines
point_colr

colour for runchart points
median_colr

colour for solid and extended median lines
sus_fill

fill value for highlighting points in a sustained run
chart_title

title for the final chart
chart_subtitle

subtitle for chart
direction

look for runs "below" or "above" the median, or "both"
facet_cols

the number of columns required for a faceted plot. Ignored if faceted is set to FALSE
save_plot

should the plot be saved? Calls ggsave on the last plot, saving in the current directory, if TRUE.
plot_extension

one of "png","pdf" or other valid extension for saving ggplot2 plots. Used in the call to ggsave.
...

further arguments passed on to function

Value

run chart(s) and a dataframe showing sustained run data if appropriate

Examples

runcharter(signals, med_rows = 13, runlength = 9,
chart_title = "Automated runs analysis",
direction = "above",facet_cols = 2,
save_plot = TRUE, plot_extension = "png")
#> Saving 7 x 7 in image
#> $runchart
#> 
#> $median_rows
#> # A tibble: 52 x 4
#>    grp       y date       baseline
#>    <chr> <int> <date>        <int>

#>  2 WardX    22 2014-02-01       11
#>  3 WardX    19 2014-03-01       11
#>  4 WardX    18 2014-04-01       11
#>  5 WardX     8 2014-05-01       11
